channel.title: Media @ Rule :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: The @media rule was originally introduced in CSS version 2. It was used to differentiate between different kinds of devices, i.e. a computer screen, printer, etc. Only the print type saw broad adoption, but it remains useful. Let’s see how we can use it. If we look at our Pages/Index.cshtml page, we can find an <aside> element that contains a banner advertisement for Bernie’s. The <aside> element is a semantic element - one that implies a specific meaning for what it contains.
